module.name: Person_organization
module.purpose: The Person organization application module supports the requirement to identify an organization and, optionally, a person within it.

inscope.li: the specification of a data structure to identify an organization
the specification of a data structure to identify a person
the specification of a data structure to relate a person to an organization
the specification of a data structure to represent an address
an organization may have a related address
a person in an organization may have a related address
all identified people must be related to organizations
an alias for the identification for organizations

outscope.li: all things which are not involved in the specification of the concepts of addresses, organization identification or the identification of people in organizations

uof.name: Person_organization
uof.description: the definitional information for the concept of an organization and an optional person.

aa.refpath: person_and_organization-> (person_and_organization.the_person-> person<- person_address.people personal_address) (person_and_organization.the_organization> organization<- organizational_address.organizations organizational_address)

description.p: This clause describes usages of this module. This module must be used in the context of another module (e.g. Part and version identification) in order to define its attachments. If a simple unclassified classification is required, security_classification and security_classification_level can provide this.
If a classification of NATO confidential is required, security_classification and security_classification_level coupled with organization_assignment can provide this.

If a classification of 'super secret' is required by an organzation designated as COMSEC, security_classification and security_classification_level coupled with organization_assignment can provide this.
